page.title: 02LAND USE IN THE LOCAL AREA
page.content: The land in this area is mainly used for intensive arable especially vegetable growing.The land is very flat and therefore the fields are regular,being divided by ditches.The land was originally reclaimed from the marsh and therefore,being expensive, there are small fields in which crops are grown which have a high return. Black,peaty soil overlying sand and boulder clay covers the area,making it very rich farming land.Barley is the chief crop in this area,followed by wheat,a small number of fields contain oats.Lettuces,potatoes and onions form the main vegetable crops,with some cabbages and carrots also being grown. Intensively managed grass is also grown,the number of wheat fields equalling the number containing hay or silage.Nearer to the town is a very small amount of enclosed rough grass.
